content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

1. Select all the equations that have the same solution as the equation \(3x-12=24\).

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 1.6.3 - are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are \(15x-60=120,\;3x=36,\;x-4=8\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

2. Select all the equations that have the same solution as \(2x-5=15\).

Correct! \(2x=20,\;2x-20=0,\;4x-10=30\)

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 1.6. to test your understanding, then come back and try this question again.

The correct answers are \(2x=20,\;2x-20=0,\;4x-10=30\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

3. Select all of the equations that are equivalent to: \(x + 0.4x - 4.2 =12.8\).

Correct! 

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 1.6.2 - are you using it the right way?

The correct answers are \(1.4x\;-\;4.2\;=12.8,\;1.4x\;=\;17,\;14x\;-\;42\;=128,\;14x\;=170\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

4. Select all of the following at are equivalent to \(3x -6 =12.\)

Correct!

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 1.6.3 to test your understanding, then come back and try this question again.

The correct answers are \(3(x-2) = 12\), \(x - 2 =4\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

5. Identify which step the mistake is made in finding an equivalent equation to \(2(x - 4) = 16\).

Step 1: \(2x -4 = 16\)
Step 2: \(2x =20\)
Step 3: \(x =10\)

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 1.6.3 - are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Step 1 has the mistake.The 2 should be distributed to BOTH terms in the parenthesis. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

6. Identify which step the mistake is made in finding an equivalent equation to \(2x +3x -4 = 20\).

Step 1: \(5x - 4 =20\)
Step 2: \(5x = 16\)
Step 3: \(x =16/5\)

Correct! 

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 1.6.3 to test your understanding, then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Step 2 has the mistake, The 4 should be ADDED to both sides of the equation. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

7. Identify which step the mistake is made in finding an equivalent equation to \(7x - 4x - 5 =16\).

Step \(1: 3x -5 =16\)
Step 2: \(3x = 21\)
Step 3: \(x =62\)

Correct! 

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 1.6.3 - are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Step 3 has the mistake. The 3 should be DIVIDED on both sides of the equation. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

8. Fill in the blank to complete the equivalent equation to 3(x - 5) = 30.  

\(3x\)- ____ =30

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 1.6.3 to test your understanding, then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 15.  Distribute the 3 to the 5 with multiplication. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

9. Fill in the blank to complete the equivalent equation to \(\frac x2-5=11\).   .

\(x\) - ______ = 22

Correct!

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 1.6.3 - are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 10. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

10. Fill in the blank to complete the equivalent equation to \( 3(x - 9) = 24\).   .

\(x\) - ____ = 8

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 1.6.3 to test your understanding, then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 9. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
